title: Dave Benson Phillips accidentally reminds us to ‘turn our c***s back’
text:
Poor Dave was just trying to do a good deed (Picture: Getty, ClickMyFace Productions)

Former CBBC presenter Dave Benson Phillips was only trying to be helpful by reminding us to turn our clocks back, but he ended up making possibly the best Twitter blunder ever.

The 52-year-old, who is best known for dunking people in gunge on CBBC game show Get Your Own Back, tweeted a kind reminder to his UK followers that the clocks go back an hour on Sunday morning.

Or Saturday night for those still out enjoying their Halloween celebrations.

But that dastardly autocorrect got the better of Dave and changed clocks to, well, ‘c***s’.

‘Have a good night whatever you’re doing… and don’t forget to put your c***s back,’ Dave tweeted late on Saturday night.

Needless to say, his Twitter followers were highly amused by the innocent mistake.

One joked: ‘Trouser adjustments aside, I’d actually forgotten about the clocks changing tonight. Thanks for the reminder!’

Another of Dave’s fans sympathised with his awkward blunder and chimed in: ‘That is hilarious bet you were mortified!!!’

One other follower and quipped: ‘This is excellent advice, thanks Dave.’

In a cheeky reference to his former job, one suggested: ‘He’s in for a gunging,’ while another fan joked: I always take care of my roosters.’

At least they saw the funny side.

But rather than just delete or replace the original tweet, Dave was a good sport and left it up, simply explaining the mistake in another tweet.

He told his followers: ‘Re; my recent tweet… the word I meant to type was ‘clocks’, and not the word that actually appeared in my tweet.

‘My sincerest apologies to those who were shocked or offended by my previous message, which was meant to be helpful. I was in a queue waiting for my takeaway meal.’

Yep, hunger will do that to you.
